result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew W. Fleischman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.dispoDesc: This sentence is due to probation being revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew W. Fleischman

records.addlTxt:
18R 006655
Civil Judgment was not entered at time of revocation, because DOC didn't credit defendant for $300 bond.  Had to wait for DOC to make correction and send us any payment to apply to assessment. Payment applied and civil judgment entered.

Court calls 16CF52 & 16CF127 @ 3:05 pm. Defendant Andrew W. Fleischman in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Defendant Andrew W. Fleischman in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives plea agreement, State makes motion to revoke DEJ on 16CF127, withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, DNA Sample and AODA, Maintain Absolute Sobriety   Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. Counseling deemed necessary, 16CF52 6 month jail, 112 days credit.  State received revocation summary packet no corrections.  ATTY Seifert received revocation summary packet no corrections.  Court will revoke DEJ on 16CF127.  State gives sentencing argument. Atty Seifert gives sentencing argument.  Def. makes statement. 
Court orders on 16CF52 165 days jail, 112 days credit.  Huber privileges. Court obligations converted to civil judgment. 16CF127 Ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, DNA Sample and $250 surcharge, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, Counseling deemed necessary by agent.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 22, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Fax to convert file to e-filing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction with Attachments

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew W. Fleischman in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF52, 16CF126, 16CF127 @ 9:07 am.  State gives plea agreement, Amend ct 1 in 16CF52 Poss of THC 961.41(3g)(e) plea to charge and Deliver in 16CF127  All other ct's and file DRI. Poss of THC ct withheld sentence 1 year probation, AODA, High school diploma or equivalent, 50 hours community service, 5 days jail, costs, DNA surcharge and sample. 16CF127 2 years Deferred Judgment agreement. State has complied with victim rights. Atty Grubofski and def. agrees with plea agreement.  Court grants motion to amend 16CF52 Poss of THC 1st offense.  Ct 1 in 16CF127 Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Grubofski has copy of information, waives reading. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Def. understands charges.  16CF62 Poss of THC 1st, Guilty plea, 16CF127 Delivery of THC, Guilty, DRI 16CF127 Ct's 2 & 3 and 16CF126 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Atty Grubofski is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and find def. Guilty in 16CF52 Poss of THC 1st and 16CF127 Deliver of THC in ct 1 find def Guilty however will agree to Deferred Judgment Agreement direct Clerk to delay entry of judgment on Ct. 1. State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Grubofski gives sentencing recommendation.  1 day credit for 16CF52 and 3 days credit for 16CF127.  Def. makes statement.  Court orders on 16CF52 Ct 1 withheld sentence 1 years probation, Completion AODA and follow through with recommendations, High School Diploma, 50 hours community service, costs, Can be taken from bond in  16CF126, $200 DNA surcharge, DNA Sample, 30 days jail, huber privileges, c on or before 12-15-16 @ 7 p.m. Credit for 1 day if revoked.  16CF127 Credit for 3 days if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Review for 11-15-2018 @ 1:00 pm on 16CF127.  Bond remains now will order $1,000 Signature bond.  16CF52 High School Diploma or equivalent HSD or GED

Defendant Andrew W. Fleischman in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF52, 16CF126 & 16CF127  @ 10:46 am. Atty Grubofski would complete initial appearance on 2 new complaints and old case to follow.   Atty Gruboski has copy of complaints, waives reading, waives time limits.  Bail on 16CF127 requested by State in the amount of 300 that was posted in 16CF126.  Court will agree that bond in 16CF126 to cover 16CF127. No additional case needs to be posted.  Def. waives time limits.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
With Antigo Police Department Investigation Report
